{{EngvarB|date=October 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} [[File:Kathleen Goligher medium.png|thumb|Kathleen Goligher]] [[File:William Jackson Crawford.png|thumb|180px|William Jackson Crawford]] '''Kathleen Goligher''' (born 1898) was an Irish [[Spiritualism|spiritualist]] [[Mediumship|medium]]. Goligher was endorsed by engineer William Jackson Crawford who wrote three books about her mediumship but was exposed as a fraud by physicist [[Edmund Edward Fournier d'Albe]] in 1921.
==Investigations==
Goligher was born in [[Belfast]]. She held [[séance]]s in her own home with seven of her family members. The psychical researcher and engineer William Jackson Crawford (1881–1920) investigated the mediumship of Goligher and claimed she had [[levitate]]d the table and produced [[Ectoplasm (paranormal)|ectoplasm]].<ref>[[Raymond Buckland|Buckland, Raymond]]. (2005). ''The Spirit Book: The Encyclopedia of Clairvoyance, Channeling, and Spirit Communication''. Visible Ink Press. p. 164. {{ISBN|978-1578592135}}</ref>
Crawford in his books developed the "Cantilever Theory of Levitation" due to his experiments with Goligher. According to his theory the table was levitated by "[[psychic]] rods" of ectoplasm which came out of the body of the medium to operate as an invisible [[cantilever]]. Crawford took flashlight photographs of the ectoplasm, and described the substance as "plasma". Crawford investigated Goligher's mediumship at her house for six years.<ref>Crawford, William Jackson. ''The Reality of Psychic Phenomena''. (1918), ''Experiments in Psychical Science''. (1919) and ''The Psychic Structures of the Goligher Circle'' (1921).</ref> He [[Suicide|committed suicide]] on 30 July 1920 for unknown reasons. Crawford's photographs of Goligher showed that the ectoplasm, frequently issued from her [[vagina]].<ref>Jones, Kelvin I. (1989). ''Conan Doyle and the Spirits: The Spiritualist Career of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle''. Aquarian Press. p. 151. {{ISBN|978-0850308372}}</ref>
There were no [[scientific control]]s in the Crawford's séances with Goligher as she and her family members had their hands and legs free at all times.<ref>Franklyn, Julian. (1935). ''A Survey of the Occult''. Kessinger Publishing. p. 233. {{ISBN|978-0766130074}}</ref> After Crawford's death the physicist [[Edmund Edward Fournier d'Albe]] investigated the medium Goligher at twenty sittings and arrived at the opposite conclusion to Crawford. According to d'Albe no [[Ectoplasm (paranormal)|ectoplasm]] or levitation had occurred with Goligher and stated he had found evidence of fraud. On 22 July 1921 he observed Goligher holding the table with her foot.<ref>[[C. E. Bechhofer Roberts]]. (1932). ''The Truth About Spiritualism''. Kessinger Publishing. p. 128. {{ISBN|978-1417981281}}</ref> He also discovered that the "ectoplasm" substance in the photographs of Crawford was [[muslin]]. During a séance d'Albe had observed white muslin between Goligher's feet.<ref>[[Edmund Edward Fournier d'Albe]]. (1922). ''The Goligher Circle''. J. M. Watkins. p. 37</ref>
In a letter to [[Harry Houdini]], d'Albe wrote "I must say I was greatly surprised at Crawford's blindness."<ref name="Houdini">[[Harry Houdini|Houdini, Harry]]. (2011 edition, originally published 1924). ''A Magician Among the Spirits''. Cambridge University Press. p. 176. {{ISBN|978-1108027489}}</ref> The conclusion from d'Albe was that the Goligher family were involved in the mediumship trickery and had duped Crawford. D'Albe published ''The Goligher Circle'' in 1922 which exposed the fraudulent mediumship of Goligher and because of the exposure she retired from mediumship in the same year.<ref name="Roach 2010"/>
==Critical evaluation== [[File:Kathleen Goligher fake ectoplasm.jpg|200px|thumb|left|Goligher with [[muslin]]]] Crawford's experiments were criticized by scientists for their inadequate controls and lack of precaution against fraud.<ref name="Prince 1919">[[Morton Prince|Prince, Morton]]. (1919). ''Review of Experiments in Psychical Science, by W. J. Crawford.'' ''[[Journal of Abnormal Psychology]]'' 14: 355-361.</ref><ref>[[Joseph Jastrow|Jastrow, Joseph]]. (1920). ''A Psychic Tragedy: The Case of Professor Crawford.'' ''The Weekly Review'' 3: 412-415.</ref>
Physician [[Morton Prince]] in the ''[[Journal of Abnormal Psychology]]'' noted that Crawford's psychic rod hypothesis "fails to account for much and cannot be reconciled with what is scientifically known as matter, or force, or electricity, or energy."<ref name="Prince 1919"/>
A review in the ''[[Journal of Applied Psychology]]'' suggested that Crawford does "not seem to have been able to avoid self-deception, and his experiments are not convincing."<ref>Anonymous. (1920). ''Experiments in Psychical Science''. ''[[Journal of Applied Psychology]]'' 4 (2-3): 280.</ref>
Psychical researcher [[Hereward Carrington]] noted that the photographs taken by Crawford look "dubious in appearance" and that "with rare exceptions, no other investigators had an opportunity to check-up his results, since outsiders were rarely admitted to the sittings."<ref>[[Hereward Carrington|Carrington, Hereward]]. (2003). ''The Story of Psychic Science''. Kessinger Publishing. p. 197-200. {{ISBN|978-1161351118}}</ref>
The surgeon [[Charles Marsh Beadnell]] published a booklet in 1920 that debunked the experiments. He also offered a cash prize to any medium who could produce a single levitation under controlled conditions.<ref name="Houdini"/>
Bryan Donkin, M.D., studied the Crawford experiments called attention to "the superabundant exposure of the massive credulity and total defect of logical power displayed by Dr. Crawford," who gives "the most pathetic picture of a willing victim of pernicious deception".<ref>[[Joseph Jastrow|Jastrow, Joseph]]. (1935). ''Wish and Wisdom: Episodes in the Vagaries of Belief''. D. Appleton-Century Company. p. 377</ref>
Psychologist [[Joseph Jastrow]] criticized the Crawford experiments as unscientific and wrote that "the minute detail of apparatus and all the paraphernalia of an engineering experiment which fills the Crawford books must ever remain an amazing document in the story of the metapsychic. As proof of what prepossession can do to a trained mind the case is invaluable."<ref>[[Carl Murchison|Murchison, Cark]]. (1927). [https://archive.org/stream/caseforandagains032328mbp#page/n333/mode/2up ''The Case For And Against Psychical Belief'']. Clark University p. 307</ref>
[[Joseph McCabe]] suggested that Goligher had used her feet and toes to levitate the table and move objects in the séance room and compared her fraudulent mediumship to [[Eusapia Palladino]] who performed similar tricks.<ref>[[Joseph McCabe|McCabe, Joseph]]. (1920). ''Is Spiritualism Based on Fraud? The Evidence Given By Sir A. C. Doyle and Others Drastically Examined''. London Watts & Co. pp. 58–61</ref> [[Edward Clodd]] also dismissed the experiments as fraudulent and noted that Goligher refused invitation to be examined by a group of magicians and scientists.<ref>[[Edward Clodd|Clodd, Edward]]. (1922). [https://archive.org/stream/occultismtwolect00cloduoft#page/28/mode/2up ''Occultism: Two Lectures Delivered in the Royal Institution on May 17 and 24, 1921'']. London: Watts & Co. pp. 28–34</ref>
Researchers such as [[Ruth Brandon]] and [[Mary Roach]] have heavily criticized Crawford's investigation, describing him as credulous and having a sexual interest in Goligher, such as an obsession with her [[underwear]].<ref name="Roach 2010">[[Mary Roach|Roach, Mary]]. (2010). ''[[Six Feet Over: Adventures in the Afterlife]]''. Canongate Books Ltd. pp. 110-116. {{ISBN|978-1847670809}}</ref><ref>[[Ruth Brandon]]. (1983). ''The Spiritualists: The Passion for the Occult in the Nineteenth and Twentieth Centuries''. Weidenfeld and Nicolson. pp. 150-151. {{ISBN|0-297-78249-5}}</ref> Crawford held a deep fixation on underwear, for example psychical researcher [[Theodore Besterman]] noted that before his suicide he "spent all his money (consequently leaving nothing) on a stack of woollen underwear for his family, sufficient to last for several years."<ref name= "Roach 2010"/>
In 1988, [[Susan Blackmore]] claimed that she had communicated with Dingwall about the case. Blackmore stated that Crawford had confessed to Dingwall that all the Goligher phenomena was fraudulent. Blackmore quotes Crawford as saying "Ding, I have to tell you something. It was all faked, all of it."<ref>[[Susan Blackmore|Blackmore, Susan]]. (1988). ''The Adventures of a Parapsychologist''. Prometheus Books. p. 211. {{ISBN|1-57392-061-4}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Eva Carrière]] *[[Mina Crandon]]

==Further reading== * [[Charles Marsh Beadnell]]. (1920). [https://archive.org/details/1920BeadnellRealityOrUnrealityOfSpiritualisticPhenomena ''The Reality or Unreality of Spiritualistic Phenomena: Being a Criticism of Dr. W.J. Crawford's Investigation into Levitations and Raps'']. Watts & Co. *William Jackson Crawford. (1921). [https://archive.org/stream/psychicstructure00craw#page/n3/mode/2up ''The Psychic Structures at the Goligher Circle'']. New York: E. P. Dutton & Company. *[[Edmund Edward Fournier d'Albe]]. (1922). [https://archive.org/stream/TheGoligherCircle/The%20Goligher%20Circle#page/n1/mode/2up ''The Goligher Circle'']. J. M. Watkins. *[[Joseph Jastrow]]. (1920). [https://archive.org/stream/weeklyreviewdevo03newyuoft#page/412/mode/2up ''A Psychic Tragedy: The Case of Professor Crawford'']. ''The Weekly Review'' 3: 412-415. *Martyn Jolly. (2006). ''Faces of the Living Dead: The Belief in Spirit Photography''. Miegunyah Press. {{ISBN|978-0977282739}} *[[Joseph McCabe]]. (1920). [https://archive.org/stream/isspiritualismba00mccarich#page/58/mode/2up ''Is Spiritualism Based On Fraud? The Evidence Given By Sir A. C. Doyle and Others Drastically Examined]''. London Watts & Co. *[[Eleanor Mildred Sidgwick]]. (1917). [https://archive.org/stream/journalofsociety18soci#page/28/mode/2up ''Review: The Reality of Psychic Phenomena: Raps, Levitation etc. By W. J. Crawford'']. Journal of the Society for Psychical Research 18: 29-31.
{{Spiritism and Spiritualism}}

{{Infobox person | name = Khader Adnan | image = | alt = | caption = | nocat_wdimage = yes <!--Wikidata image checked on 27 Jan 2017 and not used--> | native_name = {{lang|ar|خضر عدنان}} | birth_name = Khader Adnan Mohammad Musa | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|03|24|df=y}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LONG|display=inline,title}} --> | residence = [[Arraba, Jenin|Arraba]], [[Jenin]], [[West Bank]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://addameer.org/etemplate.php?id=428 |title=Prisoner Support and Human Rights Association – KHADER ADNAN MOHAMMAD MUSA |publisher=Addameer |date= |accessdate=2012-02-18 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120511195320/http://www.addameer.org/etemplate.php?id=428# |archive-date=2012-05-11 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> | nationality = Palestinian | known_for = | alma_mater = | employer = | parents = | relatives = | party = | footnotes = }}
'''Khader Adnan Mohammad Musa''' ({{lang-ar|خضر عدنان محمد موسى}}; born on 24 March 1978) is a senior member of the [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] [[Islamist]] organization [[Palestinian Islamic Jihad]]<ref>{{cite web |title=Islamic Jihad to celebrate Khader Adnan's release |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/islamic-jihad-to-celebrate-khader-adnans-release}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Islamic jihad leader held in West Bank; Israeli troops kill one man in Gaza |url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/12/17/183101.html |website=Al Arabiya}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Palestinian on Hunger Strike to Be Freed Without Court Ruling |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/02/22/world/middleeast/palestinian-on-hunger-strike-to-be-freed-without-court-ruling.html?action=click&contentCollection=Opinion&module=RelatedCoverage&region=Marginalia&pgtype=article |website=The New York Times}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Six die in renewed Mideast violence |url=http://www.boston.com/news/world/middleeast/articles/2005/06/08/six_die_in_renewed_mideast_violence/ |website=The Boston Globe}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Islamic Jihad rallies in Ramallah |url=http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/?id=13861 |website=Middle East Online}}</ref> (PIJ) and a [[Palestinian prisoners in Israel|prisoner in Israel]]. He has been held in prison 10 times under administrative detention, a procedure which allows Israel to detain people for periods of 6 months, each renewable, without the filing of charges or a trial.<ref name="Ma'an">[http://www.maannews.com/Content.aspx?id=765991 'Khader Adnan: 'The more they torture me, the more determined I become','] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 16 June 2015.</ref> As of June 15, 2015, Israeli authorities had not laid any formal charges against him, but have repeatedly held him for reasons such as "activities that threaten regional security."<ref name="BBC2">[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-17079461 Palestinians rally in support of hunger strike prisoner]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 2012-02-17. Retrieved on 2012-02-17.</ref> A visit by an [[International Committee of the Red Cross]] delegation was cancelled after Israel insisted their visit be conducted in their presence, with Khader remaining tied to his bed.<ref name="Ma'an" /> He was released on 18 April 2012 after being on [[hunger strike]] for 66 days,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/palestinian-hunger-strikes-draw-attention-to-israeli-detention-practice/2012/04/23/gIQAF2DmbT_story.html |work=The Washington Post |first=Karin |last=Brulliard |title=Middle East |date=2012-04-24}}</ref> and rearrested under the same procedure on July 8, 2014.<ref name="Ma'an" /> Khader was released in July, 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/07/11/world/israel-palestinian-detainee-released/index.html |title=Israel releases Islamic Jihad militant |author=Ed Payne and Kareem Khadder, CNN |date=12 July 2015 |work=CNN}}</ref>
Adnan is widely reported as being a spokesman and leader in the [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Palestinian Islamic Jihad]] in the [[West Bank]]. His wife says he is not involved in militant activities and is a member of the Palestinian reconciliation committee.<ref name="Ahram" /> The PIJ is designated a terrorist group by a number of Western countries and Israel,<ref name="BBC2" /> and Adnan has been convicted in the past by Israel for being a spokesperson for the group.<ref name=Catholic /> Though he has been detained several times since 1999 on the basis of alleged activities in a terrorist organization, Israel has never charged him with involvement in attacks on Israelis.<ref name=Rahman /><ref name="MSNBC">Hadid, Diaa. [http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/46323174/ns/world_news-mideast_n_africa/#.TzQLmbEge8A Palestinian prisoner on 55th day of hunger strike] ''[[MSNBC]]''. 2012-02-09.</ref>
He was arrested on 17 December 2011 after midnight.<ref name="levy" /> The following day, to protest the conditions of his arrest, Israel's policy of [[administrative detention]] and its treatment of [[Palestinian people|Palestinians]] under [[Israeli-occupied territories|Israeli occupation]], particularly prisoners, Adnan went on a [[hunger strike]]. On 21 Feb 2012 a deal was announced between Adnan and the Israeli authorities whereby they confirmed he would be released on April 17, 2012 and he would immediately end his hunger strike, the longest in Palestinian history.<ref name="CNN" /><ref name="BBC" /><ref name=Cassel /><ref name="ynetnews1">{{cite web |url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4192881,00.html |title=Palestinian detainee Adnan ends hunger strike – Israel News, Ynetnews |publisher=Ynetnews.com |date=1995-06-20 |accessdate=2012-04-19}}</ref>
He was detained again on July 8, 2014 and given a 6-month detention order.<ref name="MEE1">{{cite news |url=http://www.middleeasteye.net/news/second-hunger-strike-khader-adnan-1161047388 |work=Middle East Eye |first=Linah |last=Alsaafin |title=The second hunger strike of Khader Adnan |date=2015-06-05}}</ref> His detention was extended in January and May 2015, and on May 5, 2015 he began a second hunger strike.<ref name="MEE1" /> The government of Israel is determined to force feed him, and has drafted a law for that purpose, but the Israeli Medical Association has issued instructions to doctors to not cooperate with any force feeding.<ref name="TOI1">{{cite news |url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/doctors-association-slams-prisoners-force-feeding-bill/ |work=The Times of Israel |title=Doctors balk at bill to force-feed Palestinian prisoners |date=2015-06-14}}</ref>
Adnan owns a bakery and a produce store in his home town of [[Arraba, Jenin|Arraba]], near [[Jenin]] in the West Bank.<ref name="Guardian">Sherwood, Harriet. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/feb/16/khader-adnan-palestinian-hunger-strike?newsfeed=true Palestinian hunger striker Khader Adnan 'near death' in Israeli detention]. ''[[The Guardian]]''. 2012-02-16. Retrieved on 2012-02-16.</ref><ref name="Ma'an5" /> He has an undergraduate degree in mathematics, and is pursuing a master's degree in economics.<ref name=MacIntyre>MacIntyre, Donald. [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/khader-adnan-the-west-banks-bobby-sands-6988943.html Khader Adnan: The West Bank's Bobby Sands]. ''[[The Independent]]''. 2012-02-17.</ref><ref name=Bikya1 /> He is married to Randa Adnan,<ref name=Rahman>Rahman, Omar.[http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/02/201221984424541461.html Randa Adnan: 'I still have hope']. ''[[Al Jazeera English]]''. 2012-02-19.</ref> with whom he had two daughters, Maali and Bissan, prior to his 2011 detention, and Randa gave birth to their third child, Abdel Rahman, and in roughly late 2013, gave birth to triplets.<ref name=Pollard>Pollard, Ruth. [http://www.smh.com.au/world/hunger-striker-shines-light-on-israeli-detention-policy-20120219-1th7t.html Hunger striker shines light on Israeli detention policy]. ''[[Sydney Morning Herald]]''. 2012-02-19.</ref><ref name="MEE1" />
On 11th December 2017 the Israeli army detained Khader Adnan again.<ref>https://samidoun.net/2017/12/breaking-news-khader-adnan-seized-by-israeli-occupation-forces-launches-immediate-hunger-strike/</ref> He resumed an open ended hunger strike on 2nd September 2018.<ref>http://imemc.org/article/khader-adnan-on-18th-day-of-hunger-strike/</ref><ref>http://www.maannews.com/Content.aspx?id=780996</ref>
== Life ==
Adnan's political activism dates back to his days as a student. In 1996, while studying for his undergraduate degree in mathematics at Birzeit University, he became a political advocate on behalf of the [[Palestinian Islamic Jihad]] (PIJ).<ref name="MacIntyre" /><ref name="GN">[http://gulfnews.com/news/region/palestinian-territories/khader-adnan-no-stranger-to-hunger-strikes-1.984419 Khader Adnan no stranger to hunger strikes]. ''[[Gulf News]]''. 2012-02-22. Retrieved on 2012-02-24.</ref> A small [[Palestinian militant]] organization, the group has carried out [[suicide bombings]] and paramilitary operations against civilian and military targets and is considered a terrorist group by Israel,<ref name="WIIJ">[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/1658443.stm BBC] Who are Islamic Jihad? 9 June 2003</ref><ref name="ADL">{{cite web |url=http://www.adl.org/terrorism/symbols/palestinian_islamic_jihad.asp |title=Palestinian Islamic Jihad |publisher=[[Anti-Defamation League]] |accessdate=20 February 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120119053312/http://www.adl.org/terrorism/symbols/palestinian_islamic_jihad.asp |archivedate=19 January 2012 |df= }}</ref> the [[United States]],<ref>[https://www.state.gov/s/ct/rls/fs/2002/9014.htm US – Office of Counterterrorism] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090125080928/http://www.state.gov/s/ct/rls/fs/2002/9014.htm |date=January 25, 2009 }}</ref> the [[European Union]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/site/en/oj/2005/l_340/l_34020051223en00640066.pdf |title=List of organisations recognized as terrorist groups |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2012-04-19}}</ref> the [[United Kingdom]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/security/terrorism-and-the-law/terrorism-act/proscribed-groups |title=UK home office |publisher=Homeoffice.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=2012-04-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060630031633/http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/security/terrorism-and-the-law/terrorism-act/proscribed-groups |archivedate=2006-06-30 |df= }}</ref> [[Japan]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mofa.go.jp/policy/other/bluebook/2005/ch3-a.pdf |title=Bluebook 2005 |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2012-04-19}}</ref> [[Canada]],<ref>[http://www.psepc.gc.ca/prg/ns/le/cle-en.asp#hhi18 Public safety Canada] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061119150657/http://www.psepc.gc.ca/prg/ns/le/cle-en.asp#hhi18 |date=November 19, 2006 }}</ref> and [[Australia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nationalsecurity.gov.au/agd/www/nationalsecurity.nsf/AllDocs/95FB057CA3DECF30CA256FAB001F7FBD?OpenDocument |title=Australian national security |publisher=Nationalsecurity.gov.au |date= |accessdate=2012-04-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140204040731/http://www.nationalsecurity.gov.au/agd/www/nationalsecurity.nsf/AllDocs/95FB057CA3DECF30CA256FAB001F7FBD?OpenDocument |archivedate=2014-02-04 |df= }}</ref>
First arrested and detained by Israel in 1999,<ref name="GN" /> he has been detained roughly 10 times since—seven times by Israel (including his current detention), and 2 or 3 times by the [[Palestinian National Authority]] (PNA).<ref name=Catholic>{{cite web |url=http://www.catholic.org/international/international_story.php?id=44829 |title=Palestinian goes two months without food in hunger strike |website=catholic.org |date=2012-02-19 |access-date=2012-02-20 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131014215037/http://www.catholic.org/international/international_story.php?id=44829# |archive-date=2013-10-14 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref><ref name=Rahman /><ref name="levy" /><ref name="GN" /> The Palestinian prisoners' support group Addameer said Adnan has spent a total of six years in prison since 1999.<ref name="Addameer" /><ref name="MEE1" />
Adnan spent four months under Israeli administrative capture in 1999.<ref name="GN" /> He was arrested by the PNA eight months after being released for leading a student demonstration against [[Lionel Jospin]] in 2000.<ref name="GN" /> At the demonstration, students threw eggs or stones at the former French Prime Minister during his visit to Birzeit to denounce his characterization of [[Hezbollah]]'s military actions against the Israeli occupation as "terrorism."<ref name="GN" /><ref name=Taleb>{{cite web |last1=Taleb |first1=Fares |first2=Fadi |last2=AbuSaada |url=http://english.al-akhbar.com/content/victory-hunger-striker-khader-adnan-partial |title=Victory of Hunger Striker Khader Adnan Partial |website=english.al-akhbar.com |date=2012-02-22}}</ref> His first hunger strike, 10 days long, was undertaken during his detention by the PNA.<ref name="GN" /> He spent a year in administrative detention following his December 2002 arrest by Israel.<ref name="GN" /> Rearrested six months after his release, he was placed in solitary confinement and went on hunger strike for 28 days until the Israel Prisons Service placed him with the general prison population.<ref name=Rahman /><ref name="GN" />
He married his wife Randa Adnan in 2005; by this time he had been detained five times for his affiliation with Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ).<ref name="Rahman" /> His wife said before they married he told her that, "his life was not normal, that he might be around for 15 days and then be gone again for a long time. But I always dreamt of marrying someone strong, someone who struggles in defence of his country."<ref name="Rahman" />
Adnan has been convicted in the past by Israel for being a spokesperson for the PIJ,<ref name=Catholic /><ref name=Rahman /> and media reports indicate he served as a PIJ spokesman.<ref name="MSNBC" /><ref name="XN071805">{{cite news |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2005-07/18/content_3236358.htm |title=DFLP armed wing fires mortars at northern Gaza settlement |date=July 18, 2005 |work=[[Xinhua News Agency]] |accessdate=20 February 2012}}</ref><ref name="GDN0805">{{cite news |url=http://www.gulf-daily-news.com/NewsDetails.aspx?storyid=118683 |title=Soldier kills four in bus |date=August 5, 2005 |work=[[Gulf Daily News]] |accessdate=20 February 2012}}</ref><ref name="YNET" /> ''[[Gulf News]]'' said he has served as a spokesman for the group since 2000,<ref name="GN" /> while ''[[The Guardian]]'' and ''[[Agence France Press]]'' said he was a "one-time spokesman" for the PIJ in the past.<ref name="Guardian" /><ref name="AFP" /> Reports from ''Xinhua'' and ''[[Reuters]]'' in 2005 said he is considered a "prominent [Islamic] Jihad leader"<ref name="XNA0705">{{cite news |url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-15949129.html |title=Over 300 Jihad activists arrested by Israel |date=July 4, 2005 |work=[[Xinhua News Agency]] |accessdate=20 February 2012}}</ref> and a "senior Islamic Jihad official."<ref name="RT080405">{{cite news |title=Israeli forces detain senior Islamic Jihad official |date=August 4, 2005 |work=[[Reuters]]}}</ref> In June 2005, after PIJ members were killed in a shootout with Israeli troops, Adnan "called on all Palestinian militant groups to resume fighting with Israel" and accused the governing entity the PNA of collaborating with Israel.<ref name="BG0805">{{cite news |url=http://www.boston.com/news/world/middleeast/articles/2005/06/08/six_die_in_renewed_mideast_violence/ |title=Six die in renewed Mideast violence Islamic Jihad gunmen, Hamas engage Israelis |last=Radin |first=Charles A. |date=June 8, 2005 |work=[[The Boston Globe]] |accessdate=20 February 2012}}</ref>
In August 2005, Adnan was arrested and imprisoned by Israel for 15 months.<ref name="GN" /> According to Addameer, he held a 12-day hunger strike to protest his isolation in [[Kfar Yona]] in 2005.<ref name="Addameer">[http://www.addameer.org/etemplate.php?id=428 Khader Adnan Mohammad Musa Profile] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120511195320/http://www.addameer.org/etemplate.php?id=428 |date=2012-05-11 }}. Addameer Prisoner Support and Human Rights Association.</ref> A YouTube video of a rally in 2007 shows him praising and encouraging suicide bombings: "Who among you will carry the next explosive belt? Who among you will fire the next bullets? Who among you will have his body parts blown all over?"<ref name=Australian>[http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/islamic-jihad-prisoner-khader-adnan-ends-hunger-strike/story-e6frg6so-1226278714609 Islamic Jihad prisoner Khader Adnan ends hunger strike]. ''[[The Australian]]''. 2012-02-23.</ref> He was held by Israel for another six months in administrative detention beginning in March 2008.<ref name="GN" /> Arrested by the PNA in 2010 for his political activity,<ref name="GN" /> [[Gideon Levy]] said he undertook his first hunger strike during this 12-day detention.<ref name="levy" />
=== 2011 detention and hunger strike ===
At the time of his most recent arrest, Adnan was no longer an active spokesman for the PIJ.<ref name=Rahman /> He was working as a baker while studying for a master's degree in economics at the [[Bir Zeit University]].<ref name=Bikya1>{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/56771/16-injured-4-arrested-during-solidarity-with-hunger-striking-palestinian/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-02-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120502183133/http://bikyamasr.com/56771/16-injured-4-arrested-during-solidarity-with-hunger-striking-palestinian/ |archivedate=2012-05-02 |df= }}</ref> He owns the bakery in nearby [[Qabatya]] and a produce store in his hometown of [[Arraba, Jenin|Arraba]], near [[Jenin]] in the West Bank.<ref name="Guardian" /><ref name="Ma'an5" /> A father to two daughters, Maali and Bissan, Randa was pregnant with their third child,<ref name="Pollard" /> when he was arrested by the [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli Army]] on 17 December 2011 from their home in Arraba in the middle of the night.<ref name="levy">Levy, Gideon. [http://www.haaretz.com/weekend/week-s-end/twilight-zone-one-man-against-the-state-1.413702 Twilight Zone / 'One man against the state']. ''[[Haaretz]]. 2012-02-17.</ref><ref name="YNET">[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4187709,00.html Palestinian prisoner on 55th day of hunger strike]. ''[[YNET]]''. 2012-02-09. Retrieved on 2012-02-14.</ref> The next day he began a hunger strike that ended 66 days later on 21 February 2012.<ref name="CNN" /><ref name="BBC" /><ref name="ynetnews1" />
In a letter he gave to his lawyers for public release, Adnan explained why he was on hunger strike:
<blockquote>The Israeli occupation has gone to extremes against our people, especially prisoners. I have been humiliated, beaten, and harassed by interrogators for no reason, and thus I swore to God I would fight the policy of administrative detention to which I and hundreds of my fellow prisoners fell prey … The only thing I can do is offer my soul to God, as I believe righteousness and justice will eventually triumph over tyranny and oppression. I hereby assert that I am confronting the occupiers not for my own sake as an individual, but for the sake of thousands of prisoners who are being deprived of their simplest human rights while the world and international community look on. It is time the international community and the UN support prisoners and force the State of Israel to respect international human rights and stop treating prisoners as if they were not humans.<ref name=Cassel>Cassel, Matthew. [http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2012/02/201221715355300838.html Khader Adnan: No food without freedom]. ''[[Al Jazeera English]]''. 2012-02-17. Retrieved on 2012-02-17.</ref><ref name=Maan2>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=459445 Hunger-striking prisoner not backing down]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-11.</ref></blockquote>
Adnan was interrogated for 18 days following his arrest;<ref name=Rahman /> he told his lawyers that during this time Israeli soldiers made sexual innuendos about his wife, mocked his [[Islamic]] faith, beat him, tied him to a chair in painful positions, ripped hair from his beard and wiped dirt on his face. Israeli authorities ignored these allegations.<ref name="YNET" /> According to his wife and lawyers, Adnan's mistreatment continued and included lengthy periods of solitary confinement, multiple strip searches, and continuous abusive interrogation.
He has "officially" been under administrative detention since 10 January 2012, a term that was set to last until 8 May at which point his detention could be renewed if the Israeli authorities deem it necessary.<ref name="AlJazeera" /> As of 31 December 2011, there were 307 Palestinians in administrative detention, including 21 members of the [[Palestinian Legislative Council]], the parliament of the Palestinian Authority.<ref name=AI>Amnesty International. [https://www.amnesty.org/en/news/israel-must-release-or-charge-palestinian-detainee-prolonged-hunger-strike-2012-02-06 Israel must release or try Palestinian detainee on prolonged hunger strike]. 2012-02-06.</ref> Under the administrative detention procedure, the Israeli military can hold detainees for renewable six-month periods without charge if it deems them to be security threats.<ref name="CNN" /> The decision to detain an individual is based on evidence presented to military judges, but not the defendant or his lawyers, and is subject to judicial review.<ref name="ABA">[http://www.americanbar.org/content/dam/aba/migrated/natsecurity/counterterrorism_detention_alternatives_finalrpt.authcheckdam.pdf American Bar Association Standing Committee on Law and National Security, Exploring Counterterrorism Detention Alternatives]. ''[[American Bar Association|ABA]]''. 2009-06-02. Retrieved on 2012-02-18.</ref>
Adnan has not been formally charged with any crime; Israel claimed that he was arrested "for activities that threaten regional security."<ref name=BBC2 /> ''[[BBC]]'', ''[[CNN]]'' and ''[[Al Jazeera]]'' reported that Adnan is believed to be a leader of the PIJ in the [[West Bank]].<ref name="CNN" /><ref name="BBC" /><ref name="AlJazeera" /> ''Bikya Masr'' reported he is a "senior leader of the Islamic Jihad organization"<ref name="BM0212">{{cite news |url=http://bikyamasr.com/56442/palestinian-on-hunger-strike-in-israeli-is-man-in-danger/ |title=Palestinian on hunger strike in Israeli is "man in danger" |last=Koopmans |first=Ofira |work=Bikya Masr |publisher=9 February 2012 |accessdate=20 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120502165902/http://bikyamasr.com/56442/palestinian-on-hunger-strike-in-israeli-is-man-in-danger/# |archive-date=2012-05-02 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> and according to ''[[Al-Ahram]]'', He is a "leading figure in Islamic Jihad."<ref name="Ahram" />
It is not known if Adnan was directly involved in attacks on Israelis;<ref name="MSNBC" /><ref name="YNET" /> he has never been charged as such by Israel.<ref name=Rahman /> His wife Randa denied Adnan had any leadership role in the PIJ, or any role in militant activities, and said he was a member of a Palestinian reconciliation committee.<ref name="Ahram" /> She told ''[[YNET]]'' in 2011 that, "It's true that he was the Islamic Jihad's spokesman during the intifada, but over the past four years he had nothing to do with it … He hadn't talked to anyone from the Islamic Jihad. He left that activity altogether."<ref name=Levy2>Levy, Elior. [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4193088,00.html MK Tibi: Adnan came out a winner]. ''[[YNET]]''. 2012-02-22.</ref>
He was transferred to a hospital on December 30 but refused treatment from Israeli doctors. After meeting Adnan in the hospital, the organization [[Physicians for Human Rights-Israel|Physicians for Human Rights – Israel]], expressed "grave concern" and about his situation,<ref name="CNN">Flower, Kevin and Khadder, Kareem. [http://articles.cnn.com/2012-02-09/middleeast/world_meast_israel-palestinian-hunger-strike_1_israeli-prison-authority-israeli-human-rights-group-hunger-strike?_s=PM:MIDDLEEAST Palestinian detainee in Israel now more than 50 days into hunger strike] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120218104439/http://articles.cnn.com/2012-02-09/middleeast/world_meast_israel-palestinian-hunger-strike_1_israeli-prison-authority-israeli-human-rights-group-hunger-strike?_s=PM%3AMIDDLEEAST |date=2012-02-18 }}. ''[[CNN]]''. 2012-02-09. Retrieved on 2012-02-14.</ref> which its doctors described as "critical."<ref name="BBC">Donnison, Jon. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-16953052 Palestinian on hunger strike 'in critical condition]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 2012-02-08. Retrieved on 2012-02-14.</ref> About 50 days into his hunger strike his wife Randa was permitted to visit him and stated he appeared emaciated and dirty and was shackled to his hospital bed.<ref name="CNN" />
On 9 February, in response to criticism from human rights groups, the [[Israeli Prison Service|Israeli Prison Authority]] stated Adnan's case was being "strictly according to the law … with special attention being given to his humanitarian situation."<ref name="CNN" /> The prison service also stated that Adnan agreed to take potassium pills and does not want to die.<ref name="BBC" />
Randa Adnan appealed to [[Egypt]]ian authorities to help release her husband stating "Hope is now in Egypt to release Adnan. There's talk about Egyptian efforts to do so and I hope it's true. Egypt had an active role in the last prisoner exchange deal between Hamas and Israel – it is our older sister and we hope it intervenes."<ref name="Ahram" /> The Palestinian Ministry of Prisoners' Affairs confirmed that Egypt was intervening with Israel to release Adnan.<ref>Cassel, [http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=459324 Qaraqe: Egypt intervening to free Khader Adnan]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-10. Retrieved on 2012-02-16.</ref> She has also said that Adnan will not backtrack on his decision, and that, "When I married him I knew I should expect anything. I am proud of him whether he is under the ground or above it."<ref name="Rahman" />
Almost two months into his hunger strike, it was reported that Adnan agreed to having electrolytes, vitamins, glucose, and salts added to the water he is drinking.<ref name="Guardian" /><ref name="YNET" /> His doctors noted that, "A fast in excess of 70 days does not permit survival. Infusion of liquids, adjustment of salts, and the addition of glucose and vitamin cannot prevent certain death due to such a protracted hunger strike."<ref name="Guardian" />
An Israeli military court judge rejected his first appeal against detention in a session convened at a hospital in [[Safed]] where he was being held on 13 February 2012.<ref name="AlJazeera">[http://www.aljazeera.com/video/middleeast/2012/02/2012213153516502377.html Israel denies appeal of jailed hunger striker]. ''[[Al Jazeera English]].'' 2012-02-13. Retrieved on 2012-02-14.</ref>
On 16 February, Adnan's lawyers petitioned the [[Supreme Court of Israel]] to release him, citing that Adnan is in "immediate danger of death." Lawyer Mahmoud Kassandra stated "This is the last chance. The medical report says he could die at any minute. We hope this will succeed but I am not optimistic." Following a visit to Adnan by Rebecca Ziv from Physicians for Human Rights – Israel, she said of his situation:<ref name="Guardian" />
<blockquote>He has lost 30kg and weighs 60kg. He suffers from stomach aches, vomiting, sometimes with blood, and headaches … His general condition is pale and very weak, his tongue is smooth, he has slight bleeding from the gums, dry skin, loss of hair, and significant muscular atrophy. His pulse is weak, blood pressure 100/75. He is permanently connected to a heart monitor.</blockquote>
The Supreme Court initially scheduled a hearing for 23 February but moved it to 21 February following concerns about his health.<ref name=APHP>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/21/khader-adnan_n_1290362.html Khader Adnan, Palestinian Prisoner On Hunger Strike, To Be Freed].</ref> Moments before the hearing was convened, it was announced that a deal had been reached between Adnan's lawyers and the Israeli prosecution lawyers whereby Adnan would stop his hunger strike in exchange for his 4-month detention being counted from the day of his arrest and a promise not to renew his administrative detention barring the presentation of any new evidence.<ref name=Kershner>[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/12053/1211821-82.stm Palestinian on Hunger Strike to Be Freed Without Court Ruling]{{dead link|date=April 2012}}</ref>
=== 2014 detention and hunger strike ===
In spite of the agreement to end his first hunger strike (see above), Adnan was arrested again on July 8, 2014, at the beginning of the [[2014 Israel–Gaza conflict]], and has been held in detention ever since, beginning his second hunger strike on May 5, 2015.<ref name="MEE1" /><ref name="TOI1" /> The government of Israel is seemingly determined to break Adnan's hunger strike using force feeding techniques similar to those used by the USA in its Guantanamo Bay prison camp.<ref name="TOI1" /> Israeli Minister of Public Security Gilad Erdan was quoted as saying "Security prisoners are interested in turning hunger strikes into a new kind of suicide attack that would threaten the State of Israel. We cannot allow anyone to threaten us and we will not allow prisoners to die in our prisons."<ref name="TOI1" /> However, the Israeli Medical Society and various human rights groups are deploring this planned course of action by Israel, with the Medical Society issuing orders to Israeli doctors to not participate in any planned forced feedings except under certain limited circumstances not applicable to Adnan at this point in time.<ref name="TOI1" />
== Reactions ==
Adnan's hunger strike has drawn critical scrutiny of Israel's practice of administrative detention by a number of human rights groups, international bodies and Palestinian leaders and protesters. He has garnered a large following on [[Facebook]] and [[Twitter]]. Several of Adnan's supporters argue his case has not received proper coverage in the international and Israeli media.<ref name="Guardian" />
=== Demonstrations and solidarity strikes ===
[[File:Adan Khader, Niilin.JPG|thumb|220px|Demonstration in support of Adnan in [[Ni'lin]] on 17 February 2012. There have been several demonstrations supporting Adnan's hunger strike throughout the West Bank.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/thousands-rally-in-gaza-west-bank-in-support-of-palestinian-jailed-in-israel-1.413543 Thousands rally in Gaza, West Bank in support of Palestinian jailed in Israel]. ''[[Haaretz]]''. 2012-02-17. Retrieved on 2012-02-17.</ref>]] [[File:2012.02.23.Ramallah.3.JPG|thumb|right|220px|Graffiti stencils of Khader Adnan on a wall by [[Al-Manara Square]] in Ramallah]] [[File:2012.02.23.Ramallah.1.JPG|thumb|right|220px|Closeup view of graffiti stencil]]
Some Palestinians have protested in the [[West Bank]] and the [[Gaza Strip]] in support of Adnan.<ref name="CNN" /> Hundreds of Palestinian prisoners have joined Adnan's hunger strike in solidarity.<ref name="AlJazeera" /> Adnan's father Musa Adnan started an open-ended hunger strike on 6 February, telling ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]'' it would "enable him to support his son and understand his pain."<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=458276 Father of detained Jihad leader starts hunger strike]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-06. Retrieved on 2012-02-16.</ref> His hometown of Arraba has been a center of demonstrations, with solidarity protesters camping outside his house which Palestinian and foreign officials have been visiting to inquire about Adnan's health conditions.<ref name="Ahram">[http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/2/8/34536/World/Region/Wife-of-Palestinian-hunger-striker-calls-for-Egypt.aspx Wife of Palestinian hunger striker calls for Egyptian help]. ''[[Ahram Online]]''. 2012-02-14. Retrieved on 2012-02-15.</ref> Around 50-60 Palestinian protested outside the [[Church of the Nativity]] in [[Bethlehem]] to show solidarity with Adnan on 8 February.<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=458946 In photos: Protest in Bethlehem to support Khader Adnan]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-08. Retrieved on 2012-02-14.</ref>
On 11 February hundreds of Palestinians staged a demonstration at the [[Ofer Prison]] where Adnan was being held. The Israeli Army dispersed the protesters using rubber bullets and tear gas, injuring 16.<ref name="Ma'an2">[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=460141 Israeli court rejects Adnan appeal, 23 injured at protest]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-13. Retrieved on 2012-02-15.</ref> At a separate demonstration in [[Beit Ummar]] near [[Hebron]] two Israelis and two Palestinians were arrested by Israel.<ref name="AlJazeera" /> Dozens of students from [[Birzeit University]] that gathered outside Ofer Prison on 13 February demanding Adnan's release were dispersed by Israeli security forces resulting in the injury of 23 people.<ref name="Ma'an2" /> On 15 February, supporters began an open hunger strike at a sit-in in front of the [[International Committee of the Red Cross]] in [[Gaza City]].<ref name="Ma'an3">[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=460608 Faction leaders start hunger strike to support Adnan]. 2012-02-15. Retrieved on 2012-02-15.</ref>
On 16 February, the 61st day of Adnan's hunger strike, thousands of demonstrators protested throughout the Palestinian territories.<ref name="Guardian" /><ref name="AFP">El Batsh, Majeda. [https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jPXmzIfIq4sTivcktXqgaTPw339w?docId=CNG.d2dffb7bb5556b9a072d2459a2931d3f.4c1 Palestinian hunger striker appeals to Israel Supreme Court]. ''[[Agence France Press]]''. 2012-02-16. Retrieved on 2012-02-16.</ref> About 1,000 mostly young Palestinians protested outside of Ofer Prison before being dispersed and in Hebron, hundreds of supporters held a sit-in holding posters reading "No to administrative arbitrary detention." That same day, Palestinians observed a 10-hour hunger strike in solidarity.<ref name="AFP" />
Around 5,000 protesters demonstrated in Gaza City on 17 February chanting "We are all Khader Adnan," with the PIJ, Hamas and Fatah factions all participating.<ref name="BBC2" /> In Jenin, meanwhile, hundreds of Palestinians partook in a solidarity protest.<ref name="BBC2" />
=== Human rights groups ===
Addameer, a Palestinian prisoners' support group expressed "utmost concern about the health" of Adnan, holding Israel accountable for his life.<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=458945 Israeli court to hold session for Khader Adnan in hospital]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-08. Retrieved on 2012-02-14.</ref> The head of the Palestinian Prisoners' Society [[Qadura Fares]] condemned the Israeli court's refusal of Adnan's appeal.<ref name="Ma'an2" />
[[Human Rights Watch]] stated Israel must "immediately end its unlawful administrative detention" of Adnan and "charge or release him." Spokeswoman Sarah Leah Whitson said "Israel should end, today, before it's too late, its almost two-month-long refusal to inform Adnan of any criminal charge or evidence against him."<ref name="AlJazeera" /> [[Amnesty International]] condemned Israel's policy of administrative detention,<ref name="CNN" /> and the Israeli human rights group [[B'tselem]] sent an urgent request to Israeli Minister of Intelligence, [[Dan Meridor]], to either immediately release or try Adnan to "prevent a needless tragedy to him and his family."<ref>[http://www.btselem.org/administrative_detention/20120209_letter_to_meridor_regarding_khader_adnan B'Tselem to Meridor: Immediately release or try administrative detainee on hunger strike]. [[B'tselem]]. 2012-02-11. Retrieved on 2012-02-15.</ref>
[[Richard Falk]], the UN Special Rapporteur on Palestinian human rights, criticized "authority figures, from the UN Secretary General on down," who he said expressed empathy for [[Gilad Shalit]], while being "notably silent in the much more compelling ordeal being experienced before our eyes in the form of Mr Adnan's captivity, seemingly unto death.".<ref name=IMEU>[[Richard Falk|Falk, Richard]]. [http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2012/02/2012216105041250560.html Saving Khader Adnan's life is saving our own soul]. ''[[Al Jazeera English]]''. 2012-02-18.</ref>
=== Politicians ===
The [[Palestinian National Authority]] condemned his arrest and demanded his immediate release.<ref name="Ma'an4">[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=459174 Court delays hearing for hunger-striker Adnan]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-09. Retrieved on 2012-02-15.</ref> In response to Israel's refusal of Adnan's appeal, Minister of Prisoners' Affairs [[Issa Qaraqe]] stated the decision showed "utter disregard for Adnan's life, effectively condemning him to die."<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=460171 Prisoners minister: Adnan ruling shows negotiations failed]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-13. Retrieved on 2012-02-15.</ref> He praised Adnan for "taking a stand" against the use of administrative detention.<ref name="Ma'an4" /> At a rally on 16 February, Qaraqe said, "Khader Adnan has become a national symbol, an Arab symbol and an international symbol for his defence of the dignity of free men throughout the entire world."<ref name="AFP" />
Palestinian lawmaker [[Mustafa Barghouti]], who was injured after being shot in the foot with a rubber bullet by Israeli security forces during a solidarity protest,<ref>[http://maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=460670 Palestinian official injured at rally for Khader Adnan]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-15. Retrieved on 2012-02-18.</ref> called for an international campaign demanding Adnan's release.<ref name="Ma'an6">[http://maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=461311 Wife: Khader Adnan sticking to hunger strike]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-18. Retrieved on 2012-02-18.</ref> Palestinian Islamic Jihad leaders Sheikh Nafez Azzam, Dawood Shihab, Khader Habib and Ahmad Mudallal participated in the open hunger strike that began on 15 February saying it was the "least we can do for this legendary symbol."<ref name="Ma'an3" />
At a Friday sermon at the [[Great Mosque of Gaza]], PIJ leader Nafez Azzam stated Adnan was "not fighting for a personal cause, but for the defence of thousands of prisoners."<ref name="Ma'an5">Al-Mughrabi, Nidal. [http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=461161 Thousands rally for Khader Adnan]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-17. Retrieved on 2012-02-17.</ref> Furthermore, he accused Arab and Western countries of ignoring Adnan's case saying "Shame on the nations of hundreds of millions (of Muslims) for the fact that Khader Adnan is still in prison."<ref name="Ma'an5" /> Gaza-based Prime Minister [[Ismail Haniyeh]], declared at a rally in Gaza that same day that, "The Palestinian people, with all its components and its factions, will never abandon the hero prisoners, especially those who lead this hunger strike battle."<ref name="BBC2" />
On 18 February, it was reported that in meetings with officials from [[China]], [[Russia]], the [[United Kingdom]] and the [[European Union]], President [[Mahmoud Abbas]] and PLO negotiator [[Saeb Erekat]] pressed for Adnan's release.<ref>[http://maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=461108 President, minister press for world to save Khader Adnan]. ''[[Ma'an News Agency]]''. 2012-02-18. Retrieved on 2012-02-18.</ref>
[[United Nations]] Special Coordinator for the Middle East peace process Robert Serry instructed Israel "to do everything in its power to preserve the health of the prisoner and resolve this case while abiding by all legal obligations under international law."<ref name="AlJazeera" /> On 18 February, [[European Union]] head [[Catherine Ashton]] called on Israel to preserve Adnan's health and reiterated the EU's concern over "the extensive use by Israel of administrative detention without formal charge."<ref name=jpoststaff>[http://www.jpost.com/DiplomacyAndPolitics/Article.aspx?id=258362 EU, UN decry detention of Palestinian hunger striker]. ''[[Jerusalem Post]]''. 2012-02-18.</ref>
== See also == {{Commons category|Khader Adnan}} * [[Muhammad al-Qiq]] * [[Abdulhadi Alkhawaja]] * [[Bobby Sands]], of the [[1981 Irish hunger strike]] * [[Hana Shalabi]] * [[Maikel Nabil Sanad]] {{clear}}
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
== External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20131105053905/http://www.addameer.org/etemplate.php?id=438 Khader Adnan’s Life in Grave Danger as He Continues His Struggle Against Israel’s Human Rights Violations] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120323144420/http://www.phr.org.il/default.asp?PageID=116&ItemID=1385 According to a Medical Opinion Issued by PHR – Israel Doctor: Adnan's Life is in Immediate Danger]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Adnan, Khader}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Birzeit University alumni]] [[Category:Civil disobedience]] [[Category:Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine members]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Palestinian people]] [[Category:People from Arraba, Jenin]] [[Category:Prisoners and detainees of Israel]]

revision.text:
{{pp-semi-indef}} {{pp-move-indef}} {{Use mdy dates|date=April 2016}}{{Infobox person | name = L. Ron Hubbard | image = L. Ron Hubbard in 1950.jpg | image_size = 250px | alt = | caption = Hubbard in Los Angeles, 1950 | birth_name = Lafayette Ronald Hubbard | birth_date = {{Birth date|1911|3|13|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Tilden, Nebraska]], United States | death_date = {{Death date and age|1986|1|24|1911|3|13|mf=y}} | death_place = [[Creston, California]], United States | education = [[George Washington University]] (dropped out in 1932) | occupation = Author, religious leader | known_for = Founder of [[Scientology]] and [[Church of Scientology|its church]] | notable_works = ''[[Dianetics: The Modern Science of Mental Health]]''
''[[Battlefield Earth (novel)|Battlefield Earth]]'' | criminal_charge = [[Theft|Petty theft]] (in 1948),
[[Fraud]] ([[trial in absentia|''in absentia'']], 1978) | criminal_penalty = Fine of [[French franc|₣]]35,000 and four years in prison (unserved) | spouse = [[Margaret Grubb|Margaret "Polly" Grubb]] (1933–1947)
[[Sara Northrup Hollister]] (1946–1951)
[[Mary Sue Hubbard|Mary Sue Whipp]] (1952–1986) | children = 7: '''With Margaret Grubb:''' * [[Ronald DeWolf|L. Ron Hubbard Jr.]]* ({{abbr|d.|died}} 1991) * Katherine May Hubbard* '''With Sara Hollister''' * Alexis Hubbard* '''With Mary Sue Whipp:''' * [[Quentin Hubbard]] ({{abbr|d.|died}} 1976) * Diana Hubbard * Suzette Hubbard * Arthur Hubbard* ''* Estranged from family'' | signature = L. Ron Hubbard Signature.svg | signature_alt = | networth = [[United States dollar|US$]]600 millionVon Dehsen, Christian D. "L. Ron Hubbard," in ''Philosophers and religious leaders'', {{abbr|p.|page}} 90. Westport, Conn.: Greenwood Publishing Group, 1999. {{ISBN|978-1-57356-152-5}} | relations = [[Jamie DeWolf]] (great-grandson) }} '''Lafayette Ronald Hubbard''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|h|ʌ|b|ər|d}} {{respell|HUB|ərd}};{{cite video|url=http://www.lronhubbard.org/ron-series/profile/introduction.html|title=L. Ron Hubbard: A Profile|last=Church of Scientology International|accessdate=November 26, 2012}} March 13, 1911 – January 24, 1986), often referred to by his initials '''LRH''', was an American author and the founder of the [[Church of Scientology]]. After establishing a career as a writer of [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] stories, in 1950 he published a "branch of self-help psychology" called [[Dianetics]]. Hubbard subsequently developed his ideas into a [[new religious movement]] that he called [[Scientology]].{{cite web|url=http://www.britannica.com/topic/new-religious-movement|title=new religious movement (NRM)|publisher=|accessdate=July 25, 2016}}http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/l-ron-hubbard-publishes-dianetics Hubbard was cited by ''[[Smithsonian (magazine)|Smithsonian]]'' magazine as one of the 100 most significant Americans of all time.{{cite web |url=http://www.smithsonianmag.com/smithsonianmag/meet-100-most-significant-americans-all-time-180953341/?no-ist |title=Meet the 100 Most Significant Americans of All Time |last=Frail |first=T.A. |accessdate=November 23, 2015 }} Born in [[Tilden, Nebraska]] in 1911, Hubbard spent much of his childhood in [[Helena, Montana]]. After his father was posted to the U.S. naval base on [[Guam]], Hubbard traveled to Asia and the South Pacific in the late 1920s. In 1930, Hubbard enrolled at [[George Washington University]] to study civil engineering, but dropped out in his second year. He began his career as a prolific writer of pulp fiction stories and married [[Margaret Grubb|Margaret "Polly" Grubb]], who shared his interest in aviation. Hubbard served briefly in the [[United States Marine Corps|Marine Corps]] [[Military reserve|Reserve]] and was an officer in the Navy during World War II. He briefly commanded two ships, but was removed from command both times.{{cite news|author=Sappel, Joel |author2=Welkos, Robert W. |title=The Mind Behind the Religion, Chapter 2: Creating the Mystique: Hubbard's Image Was Crafted of Truth, Distorted by Myth |url=http://www.latimes.com/business/la-scientology062490,0,2050131,full.story |work=Los Angeles Times |date=June 24, 1990 |accessdate=July 14, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080612145705/http://www.latimes.com/business/la-scientology062490%2C0%2C2050131%2Cfull.story |archivedate=June 12, 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }} The last few months of his active service were spent in a hospital, being treated for a [[Peptic ulcer|duodenal ulcer]].{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/la-scientology062490%2C0%2C2050131%2Cfull.story |title=The Mind Behind the Religon(sic) - Los Angeles Times |date=June 12, 2008 |publisher= |accessdate=July 25, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080612145705/http://www.latimes.com/business/la-scientology062490%2C0%2C2050131%2Cfull.story |archivedate=June 12, 2008 |df= }}Miller, chapter 6 After the war, Hubbard moved into the [[Pasadena, California|Pasadena]] mansion of occultist and engineer [[Jack Parsons (rocket engineer)|Jack Parsons]].Miller, p. 113 In early 1946, Hubbard and Parsons collaborated on [[Babalon Working]], a series of magic ceremonies or rituals. Hubbard became sexually involved with Parsons's 21-year-old girlfriend, [[Sara Northrup Hollister|Sara "Betty" Northrup]], ultimately marrying her despite Hubbard still being married to first wife Polly.Miller, p. 117 In 1950, Hubbard authored [[Dianetics: The Modern Science of Mental Health]] and established a series of organizations to promote Dianetics. In 1952, Hubbard lost the rights to Dianetics in bankruptcy proceedings, and he subsequently founded Scientology. Thereafter Hubbard oversaw the growth of the Church of Scientology into a worldwide organization. During the late 1960s and early 1970s, he spent much of his time at sea on his personal fleet of ships as "[[Commodore (rank)|Commodore]]" of the [[Sea Organization]], an elite, paramilitary group of Scientologists.Stark and Bainbridge 1996, p. 213. * Dawson 2006, p. 38: "Members of the paramilitary Sea Org sign billion-year contracts of absolute loyalty and service to the highest leadership of the Church of Scientology." * Former member Aaron Judge in Squires, 29 November 2009: "The Sea Org is like a military organization. You live in cramped quarters, are served food in the cafeteria area and you basically work from 8:30 in the morning through to 11:15 at night." * Former Scientology auditor Bruce Hines in [http://edition.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0512/02/acd.01.html Cooper, 2 December 2005]: "It's very much a military organization. You wear a uniform, there's saluting, marching, standing at attention."{{cite news |title=Farce and fear in Scientology's private navy [extract from "Bare-Faced Messiah: The True Story of L. Ron Hubbard"] |author=[[Russell Miller]] |url=http://www.xenu-directory.net/news/images/thecompiler-1987-31.pdf |newspaper=[[The Sunday Times]] |date=15 November 1987 |accessdate=8 July 2013}} Some ex-members and scholars have described the Sea Org as a [[totalitarian]] organization marked by intensive surveillance and a lack of freedom.Urban 2011, pp. 124–127. His expedition came to an end when Britain, Greece, Spain, Portugal, and Venezuela all closed their ports to his fleet. Hubbard returned to the United States in 1975 and went into seclusion in the [[California]] desert. In 1978, a trial court in France convicted Hubbard of fraud [[trial in absentia|''in absentia'']]. In 1983 Hubbard was named as an [[unindicted co-conspirator]] in an international information infiltration and theft project called "[[Operation Snow White]]".{{cite web|last1=Miller|first1=Russell|title=Bare-faced Messiah|url=http://www.solitarytrees.net/pubs/bfm/bfm06.htm|publisher=Michael Joseph|accessdate=25 April 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120703021531/http://www.solitarytrees.net/pubs/bfm/bfm06.htm|archivedate=July 3, 2012|df=mdy-all}}{{cite book|last1=Reitman|first1=Janet|author2=American Society of Magazine Editors|title=The Best American Magazine Writing 2007|date=2007|publisher=Columbia University Press|isbn=9780231143912|pages=323|chapter=Inside Scientology}} He spent the remaining years of his life in a luxury motor home on his California property, attended to by a small group of Scientology officials including his physician. In 1986, L. Ron Hubbard died at age 74.{{cite book |last=Reitman |first1=Janet |title=The Best American Magazine Writing 2007 |chapter=Inside Scientology |publisher=Columbia University Press |year=2007 |isbn=9780231143912}} The Church of Scientology describes Hubbard in [[hagiography|hagiographic]] terms,Christensen, p. 228 and he portrayed himself as a pioneering [[explorer]], world traveler, and [[nuclear physicist]] with expertise in a wide range of disciplines, including photography, art, poetry, and [[philosophy]]. Though many of Hubbard's autobiographical statements have been found to be fictitious,Urban, Hugh B. "Fair Game: Secrecy, Security, and the Church of Scientology in Cold War America." ''[[Journal of the American Academy of Religion]]'' '''74''':2 (2006) the Church rejects any suggestion that its account of Hubbard's life is not historical fact.Rothstein, p. 21. In Scientology publications, he is referred to as "Founder" and "Source" of Scientology and Dianetics. His critics, including son [[Ronald DeWolf]], have characterized Hubbard as a mentally-unstable chronic liar. ==Early life== {{main|Early life of L. Ron Hubbard}} Lafayette Ronald Hubbard was born in 1911, in Tilden, Nebraska.Hall, Timothy L. ''American religious leaders'', p. 175. New York: Infobase Publishing, 2003. {{ISBN|978-0-8160-4534-1}} He was the only child of Ledora May ({{née}} Waterbury), who had trained as a teacher, and Harry Ross Hubbard, a former United States Navy officer.Miller, Russell. Bare-faced Messiah: the true story of L. Ron Hubbard, p. 11. London: Joseph, 1987. {{ISBN|0-7181-2764-1}}, {{OCLC|17481843}}Christensen, pp. 236–237 After moving to [[Kalispell, Montana]], they settled in Helena in 1913. Hubbard's father rejoined the Navy in April 1917, during [[World War I]], while his mother worked as a clerk for the state government.Miller, p. 19 During the 1920s the Hubbards repeatedly relocated around the United States and overseas. After Hubbard's father Harry rejoined the Navy, his posting aboard the [[USS Oklahoma (BB-37)|USS ''Oklahoma'']] in 1921 required the family to relocate to the ship's home ports, first [[San Diego]], then [[Seattle]].Miller, p. 23 Hubbard was active in the [[Boy Scouting (Boy Scouts of America)|Boy Scouts]] in Washington, D.C. and earned the rank of [[Eagle Scout (Boy Scouts of America)|Eagle Scout]] in 1924, two weeks after his 13th birthday. The following year, Harry Ross Hubbard was posted to [[Puget Sound Naval Shipyard and Intermediate Maintenance Facility|Puget Sound Naval Shipyard]] at [[Bremerton, Washington]].Miller, p. 27 His son was enrolled at Union High School, Bremerton, and later studied at [[Queen Anne High School (Seattle, Washington)|Queen Anne High School]] in [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]].Miller, p. 28 In 1927 Hubbard's father was sent to the U.S. Naval Station on [[Guam]]. Although Hubbard's mother accompanied her husband, while their child was placed in his grandparents' care in Helena, Montana to complete his schooling. In 1927, Hubbard and his mother traveled to Guam. It consisted of a brief stop-over in a couple of Chinese ports before traveling on to Guam, where he stayed for six weeks before returning home. He recorded his impressions of the places he visited and disdained the poverty of the inhabitants of Japan and China, whom he described as "[[gook]]s" and "lazy [and] ignorant".Atack, p. 54Miller, p. 31{{cite book |last=Lewis |first1=James R.|title=Scientology |location=USA |publisher=Oxford University Press|year=2009}} [[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 137-031735, Tsingtau, Teilansicht.jpg|right|thumb|alt=View of a coastal city from a high-altitude point at sea|Aerial view of Qingdao, China, taken in 1930, two years after Hubbard's visit]] After his return to the United States in September 1927, Hubbard enrolled at [[Helena High School]], where he contributed to the school paper,{{Cite book|title=Encyclopedia of New Religious Movements|last=Clarke|first=Peter, Ed.|publisher=Routledge|year=2004|isbn=9781134499700|location=|pages=281}} but earned only poor grades.Miller, p. 34 He abandoned school the following May and went back west to stay with his aunt and uncle in Seattle. He joined his parents in Guam in June 1928. His mother took over his education in the hope of putting him forward for the entrance examination to the [[United States Naval Academy]] at [[Annapolis, Maryland]]. Between October and December 1928 a number of naval families, including Hubbard's, traveled from Guam to China aboard the [[cargo ship]] {{USS|Gold Star|AK-12|6}}. The ship stopped at [[Manila]] in the Philippines before traveling on to [[Qingdao]] (Tsingtao) in China. Hubbard and his parents made a side trip to [[Beijing]] before sailing on to [[Shanghai]] and [[Hong Kong]], from where they returned to Guam.Miller, p. 41 Back on Guam, Hubbard spent much of his time writing dozens of short stories and essaysMiller, p. 44 and failed the Naval Academy entrance examination.{{cite web|url=http://www.religio.de/books/wakefield/us-02.html|title=Understanding Scientology / Chapter 2: L. Ron Hubbard -- Messiah? Or Madman?|publisher=|accessdate=July 25, 2016}} In September 1929 Hubbard was enrolled at the Swavely Preparatory School in [[Manassas, Virginia]], to prepare him for a second attempt at the examination.Miller, p. 45 However, he was ruled out of consideration due to his near-sightedness.Miller, p. 46 He was instead sent to Woodward School for Boys in Washington, D.C. to qualify for admission to [[George Washington University]]. He successfully graduated from the school in June 1930 and entered the university the following September.Miller, p. 47 ==University and explorations== [[File:Professor's Gate - GWU.JPG|right|thumb|alt=Open gateway with the letters G and W and the phrase "Professors Gate" visible on the arch|Professor's Gate at George Washington University]] Hubbard studied [[civil engineering]] during his two years at George Washington University at the behest of his father, who "decreed that I should study engineering and mathematics".Atack, p. 59 During Hubbard's final semester he organized an expedition to the Caribbean for "fifty young gentleman rovers" aboard the [[schooner]] ''Doris Hamlin'' commencing in June 1932. The aims of the "Caribbean Motion Picture Expedition" were stated as being to explore and film the pirate "strongholds and bivouacs of the [[Spanish Main]]" and to "collect whatever one collects for exhibits in museums".Miller, p. 52 It ran into trouble even before it left the port of Baltimore: Ten participants quit and storms blew the ship far off course to [[Bermuda]]. Eleven more members of the expedition quit there and more left when the ship arrived at [[Martinique]].Miller, p. 54 With the expedition running critically short of money, the ship's owners ordered it to return to Baltimore.Miller, p. 55 Hubbard blamed the expedition's problems on the captain: "the ship's dour Captain Garfield proved himself far less than a Captain Courageous, requiring Ron Hubbard's hand at both the helm and the charts."[http://www.lronhubbard.org/biography/adventures-explorations/carribean-motion-picture-expedition.html L. Ron Hubbard Biographical Profile — Caribbean Motion Picture Expedition]." Church of Scientology International, 2010, retrieved February 17, 2011. Specimens and photographs collected by the expedition are said by Scientology accounts to have been acquired by the [[University of Michigan]], the [[Naval Oceanographic Office|U.S. Hydrographic Office]], an unspecified national museum and ''[[The New York Times]]'',Hubbard, L. Ron. ''Mission into Time'', p. 7. Copenhagen: AOSH DK Publications Department A/S, 1973. {{ISBN|87-87347-56-3}} though none of those institutions have any record of this.Miller, p. 56 Hubbard later wrote that the expedition "was a crazy idea at best, and I knew it, but I went ahead anyway, chartered a four-masted schooner and embarked with some fifty luckless souls who haven't stopped their cursings yet."Hubbard, L. Ron, "The Camp-Fire," ''Adventure'' magazine, vol. 93 no. 5, October 1, 1935. Quoted in Atack, p. 62 He called it "a two-bit expedition and financial bust",Maisel, Albert (December 5, 1950). "Dianetics — Science or Hoax?" ''Look'' magazine, p. 79 which resulted in some of its participants making legal claims against him for refunds.Atack, p. 63 Hubbard traveled to Puerto Rico in November 1932 after his father volunteered him for the [[American Red Cross|Red Cross]] relief effort following the devastating [[1932 San Ciprian hurricane]]. In a 1957 lecture Hubbard said that he had been "a field executive with the [[American Red Cross]] in the Puerto Rico hurricane disaster".Hubbard, L. Ron. "Creating a Third Dynamic / United Survival Action Clubs," lecture of December 30, 1957. Ability Congress, 5th lecture. According to his own account, Hubbard spent much of his time [[gold prospecting|prospecting]] unsuccessfully for gold. Towards the end of his stay on Puerto Rico he appears to have done some work for a Washington, D.C. firm called West Indies Minerals Incorporated, accompanying a surveyor in an investigation of a small property near the town of [[Luquillo, Puerto Rico]]. The survey was unsuccessful. A few years later, Hubbard wrote: {{quote|Harboring the thought that the Conquistadores might have left some gold behind, I determined to find it ... Gold prospecting in the wake of the Conquistadores, on the hunting grounds of the pirates in the islands which still reek of Columbus is romantic, and I do not begrudge the sweat which splashed in muddy rivers, and the bits of khaki which have probably blown away from the thorn bushes long ago ... After a half year or more of intensive search, after wearing my palms thin wielding a sample pack, after assaying a few hundred sacks of ore, I came back, a failure.}} ==Early literary career== {{See also|Written works of L. Ron Hubbard}} [[File:New mystery adventures 193508.jpg|thumb|right|Hubbard's "Yukon Madness" was originally published in the August 1935 issue of ''[[New Mystery Adventures]]'']] [[File:Cartier Fear illo Unknown July 1940.jpg|thumb|alt=Monochrome drawing: a suited man confronts a skeletal supernatural creature, over whose shoulder two giant bats are visible|Illustration by [[Edd Cartier]] for Hubbard's story "Fear"Nicholls, Peter. ''Encyclopedia of Science Fiction'', 1978, p.108, {{ISBN|0-586-05380-8}}]] [[File:Two Complete Science-Adventure Books Winter 1950.jpg|thumb|right|Hubbard's novella "The Kingslayer" was reprinted in ''[[Two Complete Science-Adventure Books]]'' in 1950 after its original publication in a 1949 Hubbard collection]] Hubbard became a well-known and prolific writer for [[pulp magazine|pulp fiction magazines]] during the 1930s. Scientology texts describe him as becoming "well established as an essayist" even before he had concluded college. Scientology claims he "solved his finances, and his desire to travel by writing anything that came to hand" and to have earned an "astronomical" rate of pay for the times.''L. Ron Hubbard, the writer''. Los Angeles, CA : Bridge Publications, 1989. (No page number in original.) His literary career began with contributions to the George Washington University student newspaper, ''The University Hatchet'', as a reporter for a few months in 1931. Six of his pieces were published commercially during 1932 to 1933. The going rate for freelance writers at the time was only a cent a word, so Hubbard's total earnings from these articles would have been less than $100 ({{Inflation|US|100|1933|fmt=eq|cursign=[[$]]}}).Miller, p. 63 The pulp magazine ''Thrilling Adventure'' became the first to publish one of his short stories, in February 1934."[http://www.galaxypress.com/l-ron-hubbard About L. Ron Hubbard — Master Storyteller]." Galaxy Press, 2010, retrieved February 8, 2011. Over the next six years, pulp magazines published around 140 of his short stories"[http://www.lronhubbard.org/books/l-ron-hubbards-fiction-books.html L. Ron Hubbard Biographical Profile — L. Ron Hubbard's Fiction Books]." Church of Scientology International, 2010, retrieved February 8, 2011. under a variety of [[pen name]]s, including Winchester Remington Colt, Kurt von Rachen, René Lafayette, Joe Blitz and Legionnaire 148.Miller, p. 72 Although he was best known for his [[fantasy]] and [[science fiction]] stories, Hubbard wrote in a wide variety of genres, including adventure fiction, aviation, travel, mysteries, westerns and even romance.{{cite journal|last1=Frenschkowski|first1=Marco|title=L. Ron Hubbard and Scientology: An annotated bibliographical survey of primary and selected secondary literature|journal=[[Marburg Journal of Religion]]:|date=July 1999|volume=4|issue=1|url=https://www.uni-marburg.de/fb03/ivk/mjr/pdfs/1999/articles/frenschkowski1999.pdf|accessdate=May 13, 2015|page=15}} Hubbard knew and associated with writers such as [[Isaac Asimov]], [[Robert A. Heinlein]], [[L. Sprague de Camp]] and [[A. E. van Vogt]].[[Isaac Asimov|Asimov, Isaac]]. ''[[In Memory Yet Green|In Memory Yet Green: The Autobiography of Isaac Asimov, 1920–1954]]'', p. 413. New York: Doubleday, 1979. {{ISBN|978-0-385-13679-2}} His first full-length novel, ''[[Buckskin Brigades]]'', was published in 1937.{{cite news | last =Staff | title =Books Published Today | work =[[The New York Times]] | page =17 | publisher =[[The New York Times Company]] | date =July 30, 1937}} He became a "highly idiosyncratic" writer of science fiction after being taken under the wing of editor [[John W. Campbell]],Stableford, Brian. ''Historical dictionary of science fiction literature'', p. 164. Lanham, MD: Scarecrow Press, 2004. {{ISBN|978-0-8108-4938-9}} who published many of Hubbard's short stories and also serialized a number of well-received [[Novella|novelettes]] that Hubbard wrote for Campbell's magazines ''[[Unknown (magazine)|Unknown]]'' and ''[[Analog Science Fiction and Fact|Astounding Science Fiction]]''. These included ''[[Fear (Hubbard novella)|Fear]]'', ''[[Final Blackout]]'' and ''[[Typewriter in the Sky]]''.Miller, p. 86 Science fiction newsletter Xignals reported that Hubbard wrote "over 100,000 words a month" during his peak. Martin Gardner asserted that his writing "[wa]s done at lightning speed."{{cite web|url=http://www.encyclopedia.com/topic/L._Ron_Hubbard.aspx|title=L. Ron Hubbard Facts, information, pictures - Encyclopedia.com articles about L. Ron Hubbard|publisher=|accessdate=July 25, 2016}} He wrote the script for ''[[The Secret of Treasure Island]]'', a 1938 [[Columbia Pictures]] [[Serial film|movie serial]].Harmon, Jim; Donald F. Glut. ''The Great Movie Serials: Their Sound and Fury'', p. 329. London: Routledge, 1973. {{ISBN|978-0-7130-0097-9}} Hubbard's literary earnings helped him to support his new wife, [[Margaret Grubb|Margaret "Polly" Grubb]]. She was already pregnant when they married on April 13, 1933, but had a [[miscarriage]] shortly afterwards; a few months later, she became pregnant again.Miller, p. 61 On May 7, 1934, she gave birth prematurely to a son who was named [[Ronald DeWolf|Lafayette Ronald Hubbard, Jr.]] and the nickname "His Nibs", invariably shortened to "Nibs".Miller, p. 64 Their second child, Katherine May, was born on January 15, 1936.Miller, p. 70 The Hubbards lived for a while in [[Laytonsville, Maryland]], but were chronically short of money.Miller, p. 62 In the spring of 1936 they moved to [[Bremerton, Washington]]. They lived there for a time with Hubbard's aunts and grandmother before finding a place of their own at nearby [[South Colby, Washington|South Colby]]. According to one of his friends at the time, [[Robert MacDonald Ford]], the Hubbards were "in fairly dire straits for money" but sustained themselves on the income from Hubbard's writing.Miller, p. 74 Hubbard spent an increasing amount of time in [[New York City]],Miller, p. 71 working out of a hotel room where his wife suspected him of carrying on affairs with other women.Miller, p. 75Miller, p. 84 ===Near-death experience and ''Excalibur''=== {{main|Excalibur (L. Ron Hubbard)}} Hubbard's authorship in mid-1938 of a still-unpublished manuscript called ''[[Excalibur (L. Ron Hubbard)|Excalibur]]'' is highlighted by the Church of Scientology as a key step in developing the principles of Scientology and Dianetics. The manuscript is said by Scientologists to have outlined "the basic principles of human existence" and to have been the culmination of twenty years of research into "twenty-one races and cultures including Pacific Northwest Indian tribes, Philippine Tagalogs and, as he was wont to joke, the people of the Bronx"."[http://www.lronhubbard.org/biography/founder.html L. Ron Hubbard Biographical Profile — Founder]." Church of Scientology International, 2010, retrieved February 17, 2011. According to Arthur J. Cox, a contributor to John W. Campbell's ''Astounding Science Fiction'' magazine, Hubbard told a 1948 convention of science fiction fans that ''Excalibur''{{'s}} inspiration came during an operation in which he "died" for eight minutes.Gardner, p. 272 (Gerry Armstrong, Hubbard's archivist, explains this as a [[dental extraction]] performed under [[nitrous oxide]], a chemical known for its hallucinogenic effectsAtack, p. 66): {{quote|Hubbard realized that, while he was dead, he had received a tremendous inspiration, a great Message which he must impart to others. He sat at his typewriter for six days and nights and nothing came out. Then, ''Excalibur'' emerged.Malko, p. 40}} [[Arthur J. Burks]], the President of the American Fiction Guild, wrote that an excited Hubbard called him and said: "I want to see you right away. I have written THE book." Hubbard believed that ''Excalibur'' would "revolutionize everything" and that "it was somewhat more important, and would have a greater impact upon people, than the [[Bible]]."Burks, Arthur J (December 1961). "Excalibur." ''The Aberree''. It proposed that all human behavior could be explained in terms of survival and that to understand survival was to understand life.Miller, p. 80 As Hubbard biographer Jon Atack notes, "the notion that everything that exists is trying to survive became the basis of Dianetics and Scientology." According to Burks, Hubbard "was so sure he had something 'away out and beyond' anything else that he had sent telegrams to several book publishers, telling them that he had written 'THE book' and that they were to meet him at [[Pennsylvania Station (New York City)|Penn Station]], and he would discuss it with them and go with whomever gave him the best offer." However, nobody bought the manuscript. [[Forrest J Ackerman]], later Hubbard's [[literary agent]], recalled that Hubbard told him "whoever read it either went insane or committed suicide. And he said that the last time he had shown it to a publisher in New York, he walked into the office to find out what the reaction was, the publisher called for the reader, the reader came in with the manuscript, threw it on the table and threw himself out of the skyscraper window."[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uhl2bE-1LiA&feature=youtu.be&t=8m29s Ackerman, Forrest J (November 19, 1997) ''Secret Lives: L. Ron Hubbard''], Channel 4 Television. Hubbard's failure to sell ''Excalibur'' depressed him; he told his wife in an October 1938 letter: "Writing action pulp doesn't have much agreement with what I want to do because it retards my progress by demanding incessant attention and, further, actually weakens my name. So you see I've got to do something about it and at the same time strengthen the old financial position."Letter from L.
